name: distributable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
able to be distributed (= given out) to shareholders (= people who own part of a company and therefore get part of its profits): If the company has no distributable reserves, it cannot pay dividends. Dividends can only be paid from distributable profits. Compare
non-distributable
More examplesFewer examplesThe exact amount of distributable income can only be determined at the end of the fiscal year.Holding gains are not considered distributable except upon liquidation of the firm.Distributable earnings is the profit from the company's main business minus adjusted income taxes.Free cash flow and net earnings both affect the per share calculations for distributable cash.
